name: Holiday Inn Express San Antonio North

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great little hotel - used to be the Bexar County Jail. Very cool history for history buffs. The windows are original (from the 1800's) and a sign on them says to please not touch or try to open due to their age. Some old photos throughout the hotel tell the history of the building The hotel and the rooms are small but the rooms are clean and the staff is wonderful. Convenient parking, too (for a fee). You can walk to everything downtown.
reviews.title: Stay overnight in Jail!

reviews.text: Our family of four stayed here May 10-11, 2013. Parking was confusing at first, but we pulled in next to the handicapped spot in front of the hotel while we checked in. The parking lot is right across the tiny street in front of the lobby (if you stand in the front door and look straight ahead, you will see the little parking lot). Our parking was included with our (unbeatable) rate, and a very friendly and helpful security guard patrolled the parking lot all night.
reviews.title: Attentive Staff, Clean Room/Bathroom, WARM Pool!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was clean, and despite its smallish size, we did not feel cramped. There was a fairly large closet with a huge mirrored door, and the historic windows had blackout curtains. The air conditioning unit did smell a bit musty while it was on, but it wasn't too bad. I ended up turning it off, and our room stayed around 72 degrees all night. I would like to see a couple of hooks by the door inside the room. There is a lot of space right there, and the hooks would help utilize that area better. We were on the second floor, which was part of the original building.
reviews.title: Anniversary road trip!
Okay for budget hotel in San Antonio
reviews.text: The bathroom was attractive and clean, with no mildew or peeling wallpaper in sight. Be it the cloth shower curtain or user error, we ended up with some water on the floor and asked for an extra bathmat. We had enough of the other towels to last us both nights, and we did not require housekeeping.

Breakfast was great. We had omelets and biscuits and sausage gravy the first morning and scrambled eggs and bacon the following morning. There is also a fun little machine in the corner that rolls out two fresh pancakes on a conveyor belt with the push of a button. Of course, there was a plentiful assortment of cereal, instant oatmeal, bagels, bread, danishes, cinnamon rolls, muffins, yogurt, milk, juices, tea and coffee. We ate our breakfast the first morning by the pool, which the front desk attendant graciously opened up early for us.
reviews.title: Good Hotel Value
Great stay at the old jail
reviews.text: Three of my friends and I stayed 3 nights at this hotel and we throughly enjoyed it. We had two twin rooms each containing 2 queen beds. The beds were super comfortable and the rooms clean. The hotel is older and as such has older decor. There is free Wifi with a great signal and there is also a free breakfast included in the room rate. The Breakfast is excellent and included in the room rate. Breakfast included Coffee, tea, juices, bacon, eggs, cereals, yoghurts and pastries. Eric on the front desk provided fantastic service during our stay. Would happily stay again.

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: Clean, quiet, great breakfast with many choices! Staff were friendly and accommodating. 15 minute easy walk to all major attractions. Reasonably priced for its location. Would definitely stay here again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Holiday Inn Express is purely middle class fantastic! We stayed for 7 days. Our room was large and clean with bars on the window (from old jail days) and overlooked an old livery that is now law offices. It had a foyer area with a chair and a coffee/tea bar area that had a sink, dishwashing soap, paper towels and a basket with disposable plates, plastic cutlery and microwavable containers and opened into a large bedroom with a comfy bed that had both firm and soft pillows!.The bathroom was large and clean, as well, and stocked with toiletries. There are mirrors on the closet door, in the bathroom and when you enter the room.
reviews.title: Middle Class Fantastic

reviews.text: The breakfast can only be described as a well stocked home kitchen complete with grandma cooking up eggs, sausage, biscuits, bacon in whatever way she chooses that day. There is also a cool pancake machine in the corner.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable stay

reviews.text: As if that weren't enough, the location is superb. You can take a right when exiting and right on Houston and walk to the Alamo (about 5 blocks) or go left to Commerce and left to be immediately by the Spanish Governor's mansion and one block further to the main plaza with the San Fernando Cathedral. The staff will arrange tours, although we walked everywhere and I will say that the town is totally walkable if physically fit. The hotel has super easy access to buses and trolleys.
reviews.title: Unique experience as located in historic jail building
Hotel located in an old jail
reviews.text: The HI Express is located in a registered historic building that was a jail. The staff wear polo shirts that say "guard"
Parking is located across the street and is free but entrance into the facility means traversing 6-8 steep steps just to get in.
reviews.title: Overall very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lobby presents well and depending on the room, they will be decent size or minuscule .
reviews.title: Excellent value!!!

reviews.text: Rooms one the first floor have no view and are minuscule. Recommend higher floors.
reviews.title: Excellent service, location, and price.

reviews.text: Our room was on the fifth floor and we had a decent view but the air conditioner spewed out some black fuzz every time it came on.
reviews.title: Great service, not so great room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I always stay at the holiday inn hotel wherever I go. This time I stay at this hotel and walked to the River-walk which is not too far. The location is good,the hotel looks old, but it was clean. The problem was I got wireless Internet just for a couple of hrs after that no more access. The neighbors in the other room they were too loud they were fighting at 2 am very loud. I tried to contact the desk staff but they never answered the phone. I won't stay in this hotel if I am in the area.
reviews.title: Bad experience

reviews.text: I stayed two nights for the incredibly low rate of $109.00 per night. My room was very nice and quiet. I had a coffee pot, a microwave and a mini-frig in my room, which I really liked. It also had free high-speed Wifi connection which worked very, very well. I used the fitness center and found it to have everything I wanted: a treadmill, an elliptical and a reclining bicycle. It was equipped with fresh towels and a water cooler and other small amentities, plus a good sized cable TV. I didn't get a chance to use the pool but I did check it out. I do water exercise so pools are very handy when I travel. The pool is small, you won't be doing laps, in it but if you want to refresh yourself on a hot day or get some water exercise in, it is just fine. The hot breakfast in the morning was GREAT! It was free and it included scrambled eggs, bacon, hot biscuits, sausage gravy, and pancakes. The most hilarious thing that I saw was the "pancake machine." You pressed one button and then two pancakes came out. They were tasty pancakes. Also they had high quality coffee on tap in the lobby 24/7 which I appreciate because I drink coffee non-stop. Another great feature is that it is right by the local Trolley route. The City of San A ntonio funds a trolley route that takes people from hotels to convention centers and the entertainment/restaurant district. I used that instead of a cab and saved a good deal of money. The staff were very helpful and professional. I will definitely stay in this hotel next time I am in San Antonio. What a bargain for a great, comfortable stay
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We always stay at the Holiday Inn Express San Antonio North (120 Camaron Street) when we go to San Antonio. We have season tickets for the Broadway shows at the Majestic Theatre and this hotel is within SAFE walking distance of the River Walk, Market Square, and the Majestic Theatre. If you are a Priority Member, you get free parking, so be sure to sign up for Priority membership. The staff is very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Excellent Rate and Location for Downtown San Antonio

reviews.text: This is a historical location--the old jail and the staff wears uniforms that say "Guard," showing their sense of humor.
reviews.title: Ever stayed overnight at a former jail?
Adventure with history
reviews.text: You can walk to Mi Tierra or La Margarita restaurants or walk down to the River Walk for an amazing assortment of restaurants. You can also take the trolley to further locations such as the Alamo, unless you are looking for a longer walk.

aka: Holiday Inn Express San Antonio North Hotel
description: San Antonio Hotel Near a Variety of Attractions The historic atmosphere, excellent accommodations and friendly staff make the Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites in San Antonio, Texas near the Alamo, River Walk area, and Trolley perfect for both business and leisure travelers.Our hotel in San Antonio, TX is conveniently located within walking distance from the Alamo and the world-famous San Antonio River Walk. Visitors may enjoy shopping at La Villita Historic Arts Village, Rivercenter Mall and Market Square, the largest Mexican marketplace outside Mexico. Ride the local trolley to the many attractions within a mile of our hotel, such as the Tower of the America and IMAX theater.Business travelers benefit from the great location of this historic hotel in San Antonio, TX. We are situated near Valera Energy Corporation, Coca Cola and Pepsi bottling companies, Boeing and Fort Sam Houston. Henry B. Gonzales Convention Center and the Alamodome are a mile from our San Antonio, Texas hotel, which features free high-speed Internet access and a 24-hour business center.From the complimentary hot breakfast bar to the flow-regulated Kohler showerheads, our accommodations go beyond cheap hotels in San Antonio. Relax in the pool and whirlpool, work out in the fitness center and rest comfortably every night in a triple-sheeted bed with four pillows. You'll receive excellent service and amenities while lodging in our San Antonio, Texas hotel.
